title: Embedded Software Dev Engineer, Kuiper Software & Networking
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Design, craft, and deploy reliable embedded software for consumer electronic products.
• Develop embedded software for terrestrial devices within the Project Kuiper system.
• Participate in all phases of SDLC including requirements gathering, design, code, test, and code/test coverage.

REQUIREMENTS:
• Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident, or lawfully admitted into the U.S.
• 3+ years of non-internship professional software development experience.
• 2+ years of non-internship design or architecture of new and existing systems experience.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Experience with real-time embedded software philosophies and practices.
• Expertise with Linux and RTOS.
• Programming experience in assembly, C, C++, Rust or other languages.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:

• Expertise with Linux and RTOS.
• Programming experience in assembly, C, C++, Rust or other languages.

title: Controls SDE, UTR, Last Mile
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Develop complex mechatronics products for Amazon's Last Mile ecosystem.
• Build scalable tools and technology for delivery hubs.
• Troubleshoot PLC code, carry out testing, build prototypes, and support execution.

REQUIREMENTS:
• 3+ years of non-internship professional software development experience.
• 2+ years of experience in embedded software development for mechatronic systems.
• Experience with industrial automation systems and communication protocols.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Experience with TIA Portal 16+, Codesys 3.5, HMI, VFDs, Servo Drive, Industrial Fieldbuses.
• Knowledge of Object-Orientated Industrial Programming (OOIP).
• Experience with Python, Ruby, Golang, Java, C++, C#, Rust.

title: 2026 Applied Science Internship - Reinforcement Learning & Optimization (Machine Learning) - United States, PhD Student Science Recruiting
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Conduct research into theory and application of deep reinforcement learning.
• Propose and deploy solutions drawing from various scientific areas.
• Develop scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, and implementation.

REQUIREMENTS:
• Enrolled in a PhD and at least 18 years old.
• Able to work 40 hours/week minimum and commit to a 12-week internship.
• Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Optimization, Programming/Scripting Languages, Statistics.
• Reinforcement Learning, Causal Inference, Large Language Models.
• Time Series, Graph Modeling, Supervised/Unsupervised Learning, Deep Learning, Predictive Modeling.

title: Applied Scientist, Books Core Recommendations
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Collaborate with team to develop and implement innovative science solutions.
• Analyze customer behavior and product relationships using Amazon's resources.
• Assist in developing and maintaining recommendation models and running A/B tests.

REQUIREMENTS:
• PhD or Master's degree with 4+ years of experience in CS, CE, ML or related field.
• Programming experience in Java, C++, Python or related language.
• Experience in algorithms, data structures, parsing, numerical optimization, data mining, parallel and distributed computing.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Natural Language Processing (NLP)
• Reinforcement Learning (RL)
• Deep learning and graph networks.

title: Sr. Software Engineer - Digital Twin, Project Kuiper
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Develop and deploy digital twin models for hardware system health tracking.
• Perform simulations, scenario testing, and predictive analysis for system optimization.
• Develop cloud-native software systems and automate operational workflows.

REQUIREMENTS:
• 5+ years of professional software development experience.
• Experience in leading design or architecture of new and existing systems.
• Experience in building and deploying models, statistical analysis, and data analysis tools.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Python, Java or other modern programming languages.
• Cloud-native software systems.
• APIs for software services.

title: ServiceNow Application Development Engineer, Ops Tech Solutions
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Develop customer experience and set new service standards in IT Delivery.
• Manage administration, maintenance, and development of the ServiceNow platform.
• Create ServiceNow workflows and business rules for service improvements.

REQUIREMENTS:
• Bachelors degree in IT, MIS, Computer Science, Business or equivalent work experience.
• Certified ServiceNow Administrator (CSA) or other ServiceNow certification.
• 3+ years of direct experience with the ServiceNow platform.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Experience with JavaScript, Perl or PHP.
• Experience with web service integrations using REST, SOAP, etc.
• Experience with Agile scrum/Kanban methodology.

title: Systems Development Engineer - Ground Infrastructure, Project Kuiper
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Build tools and processes for monitoring, operating, and scaling ground infrastructure.
• Automate repetitive processes to eliminate outages and ensure high availability.
• Provide critical operations support and incident response, participating in an on-call rotation.

REQUIREMENTS:
• Must be a U.S. citizen, national, permanent resident, refugee, or granted asylum.
• Experience in automating, deploying, and supporting large-scale infrastructure.
• Experience programming with at least one modern language.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Familiarity with Python, Ruby, Golang, Java, C++, C#, Rust.
• Experience with Linux/Unix.
• Experience with CI/CD pipelines build processes.

title: Software Dev Engineer II, Amazon
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Lead the development of new state-of-the-art products at internet scale.
• Develop and maintain AI-powered advertising solutions and services.
• Collaborate closely with Principal Engineer and Scientists on technical strategy.

REQUIREMENTS:
• 3+ years of professional software development experience.
• 2+ years of experience in system design or architecture.
• Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Experience with at least one software programming language.
• Familiarity with full software development life cycle.
• Experience with source control management and build processes.

title: Software Dev Engineer II - AMZ26335.1
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Design, develop, implement, test, and document software applications, tools, systems, and services.
• Translate functional requirements into robust, efficient, supportable solutions.
• Mentor junior development engineers and produce comprehensive, usable software documentation.

REQUIREMENTS:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
• One year of experience in the job offered or a related occupation.
• Must have experience in designing and developing large-scale, multi-tiered, multi-threaded software.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Proficient in C#, C++, Java, or Perl.
• Experience with Object Oriented Design.
• Knowledge of new or existing software products and tools.

title: System Development Engineer, macOS MDM, Kuiper Devices & Systems
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Design and maintain MDM configurations for device lifecycle management.
• Implement scalable solutions for managing endpoints, including patching and reporting.
• Collaborate with security teams to ensure device configurations comply with internal policies.

REQUIREMENTS:
• Must be a U.S. citizen due to government-imposed requirements.
• Experience in automating, deploying, and supporting infrastructure.
• Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Python, Ruby, or Java.

KEY TECHNOLOGIES:
• Apple ecosystem device management, including JAMF Pro, Apple Business Manager.
• MDM solutions like FleetDM for device management tasks.
• Linux/Unix experience is preferred.
